definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: Very few gas-powered passenger cars can beat the Chevy Volt off the line.
sentences.chinese: 燃油动力的乘用车很少能打败雪佛兰伏特。

sentences.english: A voltmeter is an instrument used for measuring the electrical potential difference between two points in an electric circuit.
sentences.chinese: 伏特计是用于测量电路中两点之间电势差的仪器。

sentences.english: Fried mutton fat with onions goes well with vodka.
sentences.chinese: 油炸肥羊肉伴洋葱，再加上一杯伏特加就是绝配了。

sentences.english: At zero volts, most of the bacteria survived.
sentences.chinese: 当电压是零伏特时，绝大多数细菌存活。

sentences.english: Small batch vodka alembic distilled from local grain and the spring water.
sentences.chinese: 这种限量伏特加采用当地的谷物和泉水酿造。

sentences.english: And now you're saying there are two bottles of vodka in it.
sentences.chinese: 现在你又说有两瓶伏特加酒在里面。

sentences.english: Viktor served us a lot of vodka.
sentences.chinese: 维克托向我们提供了很多伏特加。

sentences.english: Where the volt is too large a unit, we use the millivolt or microvolt.
sentences.chinese: 如果伏特这个单位过大，我们就用毫伏或微伏。

sentences.english: The majority of the world's vodkas are distilled from what product?
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数伏特加是由什么酿制而来的？

sentences.english: You stop counting cows and open another bottle of Vodka.
sentences.chinese: 你放弃数牛了，开另一瓶伏特加继续喝。

sentences.english: Use Coffee flavoured Vodka, or a drop of Kahlua, Garnish with Coffee bean.
sentences.chinese: 使用咖啡味伏特加，少许卡鲁瓦，饰以咖啡豆。

sentences.english: To increase its life add 1 teaspoon vodka.
sentences.chinese: 加1茶匙伏特加可以延长保存期限。
莫斯科人善饮伏特加酒。

sentences.english: Your Vodka can wait, my good Alexi.
sentences.chinese: 我的好亚历斯，你的伏特加在等你。

sentences.english: Add the vodka and lime juice, stir and top with ginger beer.
sentences.chinese: 随后加入伏特加和青柠檬汁，搅拌均匀后用姜啤续杯。

definition: volt-ampere (measure of apparent power in alternating current circuits)
Hertz (name)/Heinrich Hertz (1857-1894), German physicist and meteorologist, pioneer of electromagnetic radiation
electron volt (unit of energy used in particle physics, approximately 10^-19 Joules)
